Package com.stehno.ersatz.cfg

Interface Expectations

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AnyExpectations, DeleteExpectations, GetExpectations, HeadExpectations, OptionsExpectations, PatchExpectations, PostExpectations, PutExpectations
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExpectationsImpl
    public interface Expectations
extends AnyExpectations, GetExpectations, HeadExpectations, PostExpectations, PutExpectations, DeleteExpectations, PatchExpectations, OptionsExpectations
    The Expectations interface is the root element of the expectation configuration, which provides the ability to define request expectations and responses for test interactions.

    Internal expectation matching is done using Hamcrest Matchers - the methods without explicit Matches provide one as a convenience based on the property and value type (see method description). All configured matchers must match for a specific expectation to be considered a match and if there are multiple matching expectations, the first one configured will be the one considered as the match.

    • Method Detail

      • ws

        default WebSocketExpectations ws​(java.lang.String path)
        Defines a web socket expectation. When this expectation block is configured, at least one web socket connection will be expected in order for the verification to pass.
        Parameters:
        path - the request path
        Returns:
        a reference to the web socket expectations

      • ws

        default WebSocketExpectations ws​(java.lang.String path,
                                 @DelegatesTo(value=WebSocketExpectations.class,strategy=1)
                                 groovy.lang.Closure closure)
        Defines a web socket expectation. When this expectation block is configured, at least one web socket connection will be expected in order for the verification to pass.
        Parameters:
        path - the request path
        closure - the configuration closure
        Returns:
        a reference to the web socket expectations

      • ws

        WebSocketExpectations ws​(java.lang.String path,
                         java.util.function.Consumer<WebSocketExpectations> config)
        Defines a web socket expectation. When this expectation block is configured, at least one web socket connection will be expected in order for the verification to pass.
        Parameters:
        path - the request path
        config - the configuration consumer
        Returns:
        a reference to the web socket expectations
